original_title: Sri Lanka health sector to receive WHO assistance
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s health sector is to receive financial and technical support from the World Health Organization (WHO) to improve health care in the country.
Ministry of Health Secretary Palitha Mahipala met WHO Representative to Sri Lanka Dr Alaka Singh recently.

“Dr Alaka Singh agreed the World Health Organization will provide financial and technical support for the improvement of the following areas of the health service in Sri Lanka,” the government information department said in a statement.

WHO will provide technical and project support for programs to combat dengue, prevent antibiotic resistance, data analysis support to prepare a 10-year health policy, and support necessary technical and skills development for National Medicines Regulatory Authority (NMRA) staff.
Experts from the WHO South-East Asia Regional Office as well as its Geneva Headquarters will provide support. (Colombo/Dec4/2023)
